PROJECTS TAKEN.Title of Project: Secure Biometric Authorization System based on Finger Vein Identification
PROJECTS TAKEN.Description: Near-Infrared images of fingers showing fingerveins were preprocessed using edge detection based ROI selection, and enhaced using Fuzzy Contrast Adjustment and CLAHE and noise was cleaned using Gaussian filters. Authentication was done by matching the test images against the database on basis of a distance-based classifier, where similarity is measured using watershed region and palette matching.

Project Guide: Prof. U. Kr. Sarkar, IIM-C(Joka) 

Expert Advice for 75 companies from Twitter/Moneycontrol.com mined using a web-crawler. A set of frequent key words to analyse this data set is optimized using Genetic Algorithm. The optimized keyword set is used to analyse future advices to predict share prices and develop a Portfolio management algorithm. 

Technical Keywords: Data Mining, Webcrawler, Genetic Algorithm, Optimization 

Language: Java

PROJECTS TAKEN.Title of Project: Analyzing Social Media Text using Map Reduce and Apache Hive BigData  Analytic Models on Apache Hadoop platform
PROJECTS TAKEN.Description:
Established Apache Hadoop, Map Reduce and Apache Hive infrastructure at Distributed Computing lab of JU-CSE department. Use of Mapreduce to identify frequent keyterms. Hive was used to formatize data on basis of company name, expert name, keyterms and numerical value of the sentiment expressed,
Further analysis was done using Genetic Algorithms to analyze credibility of the textual advices and forecasting using linear regression.

PROJECTS TAKEN.Title of Project: Cost Sensitive Classification using Neural Network trained with Cuckoo  Search Algorithm in Asymmetric Error Cost Contexts
PROJECTS TAKEN.Description:
Implemented cost-sensitive training a Multi-Layer Perceptron with Back- Propagation Neural Network using asymmetric error cost functions

Use of PSO (Particle Swarm Optimization) and Cuckoo Search Evolutionary Algorithms for finding the best cost ratio and Neural Network structure

Identifying contexts in real world where the False Positive and False Negative Costs are highly asymmetric and applying the implementation for classification

Implementing cost-insensitive Neural Nets and Bayesian Belief Networks for comparison.
